edu.cnm.deepdive.ca.rps.models

Class Terrain

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.cnm.deepdive.ca.rps.models.Terrain

  • public class Terrain
extends Object
    This class models cyclic dominance in a simplified ecosystem as a form of the game Rock-Paper-Scissors (RPS), played on a toroidal terrain. RPS interactions happen between pairs of neighboring Breed instances located on square lattice points on a 2-dimensional torus. In each iteration, one such pair is chosen at random, with the loser replaced by an instance of the winner's breed.

    This model may also be viewed as a 2-dimensional, 3-state stochastic cellular automaton (CA). The state of each cell in generation (n + 1) is based on the state of that cell in generation n and the random selection of a single cell and one of its neighbors. If a given cell is note one of the 2 randomly selected cells, then its state is unchanged; otherwise, the new state of that cell (and that of the other cell selected at random) is based on the outcome of the conflict between the 2 cells – that is, on the RPS game played between them.

    Version:
    1.0, 2017-10-20
    Author:
    Nicholas Bennett & Deep Dive Coding Java+Android+SalesForce Bootcamp Cohort 2

      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Terrain.Neighborhood
      This class enumerates 2 commonly used neighborhoods for determining adjacency in a number of 2-dimensional cellular automata (CA) and similar models.

      void step()
      Update the state of the system by performing getSteps() iterations of random pair selections and resolution of RPS interactions between the members of the selected pairs.

        Returns:

        Returns:

      • getRng

        public Random getRng()
        Returns the instance of Random currently assigned as the RPS system's source of randomness. This instance is used for lattice population initialization and for selection of random neighboring pairs in each iteration.
        Returns:
        source of randomness

      • setRng

        public void setRng(Random rng)
        Sets the instance of Random to be used as the RPS system's source of randomness, for randomness. This instance is used for lattice population initialization and for selection of random neighboring pairs in each iteration.
        Parameters:
        rng - source of randomness

      • getSize

        public int getSize()
        Returns the size (height and width) set for the square lattice used as the RPS terrain. Note that if setSize(int) has been invoked after the most recent invocation (explicit or implicit, via step()) of initialize(), the value returned may not be equal to the current size of the array returned by getSnapshot().
        Returns:
        terrain lattice size (height and width)

      • setSize

        public void setSize(int size)
        Sets the size (height and width) that will be used for creation of the terrain lattice in the next execution of initialize().
        Parameters:
        size - terrain lattice size (height and width)

      • getIterationsPerStep

        public int getIterationsPerStep()
        Returns the number of low-level iterations performed in each high-level execution step – i.e. each invocation of the step() method.
        Returns:
        iterations per step
